DOC.brief_summary: Standard therapy for chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) is (Peg/RBV) combination therapy obtaining sustained virologic response (SVR) in 77% of naïve patients with genotype 1-3 Studies rarely address the issues of improving host factors. The current study examines whether adding vitamin D with Peg/RBV, a potent immunomodulator, could improve viral response(SVR)compared to Peg/RBV.
DOC.brief_title: Add Vitamin D With Standard of Care for Chronic Hepatitis C Patients
DOC.detailed_description: The working hypothesis is that Adding vitamin D to conventional Peg/RBV therapy for naïve, genotype 1-3 patients with chronic HCV infection significantly improves RVR, EVR additionally.
DOC.criteria: Chronic genotype 13 HCV infection Treatment Naive Child B and C HCC patients Pregnancy
